Issues.Title: Update postcss: 8.4.18 ‚Üí 8.4.19 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è postcss (8.4.18 ‚Üí 8.4.19) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/postcss/postcss/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

8.4.19

  • Fixed whitespace preserving after AST transformations (by @romainmenke).

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 8 commits:

  • Release 8.4.19 version
  • Update dependencies
  • Merge pull request #1790 from romainmenke/fix-whitespace-bug--passionate-african-bush-elephant-9ae98c1a5a
  • fix whitespace bug
  • Merge pull request #1789 from eduardopilati/patch-1
  • Update plugins.md
  • Update dependencies
  • Add Node.js 19

Issues.Title: Fix `foo-[abc]/[def]` not being handled correctly
Issues.Body:
This commit does a bit of cleanup, it also ensures that we lookup `[abc]/[def]` in the `values` first, and if it doesn't exist, then we start parsing all the values out.

We also ensure that `abc` and `def` are parsed out correctly for the correct type instead of dropping the rule altogether because we happen to end up with an `any` rule.

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix `foo-[abc]/[def]` not being handled correctly" (#9866)

Issues.Title: Can't use arbitrary variants with group
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.2.4 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Vue v3.2.45, Vite v3.2.4 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v19.1.0 **What browser are you using?** Vivaldi v5.5.2805.44 (Chromium based) **What operating system are you using?** Archlinux **Reproduction** ```html
Header title
Here come the main content
``` **Describe your issue** I'm trying to use the arbitrary variant `[&>div:first-child]` to target the first child `div` (aka header) and add the `group` class on it. I can't directly add the `group` class on the "header" `div` because that part of the DOM come from third party library. My goal is to show the extra header action button when the user hover the "header" `div` of the third party component. I haven't see anything in the documentation which forbid that kind of combination but perhaps I miss it ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't use arbitrary variants with group" (#9860)

Issues.Title: Subtraction in `calc()` arbitrary values not always normalized properly
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Tailwind Play, Webpack v5

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.13.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Ubuntu 18.04 via WSL

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/KnpyuskR45

**Describe your issue**

A value like `calc(1-(var(--something)*0.5))` or `calc(1-var(--something)*0.5)` in an arbitrary variant is not normalized properly, with spaces missing around the subtraction operator:
```css
.mt-\[calc\(1-var\(--something\)\*0\.5\)\] {
  margin-top: calc(1-var(--something) * 0.5);
  /* expected margin-top: calc(1 - var(--something) * 0.5); */
}
```
I would have expected this function consistently akin to the other mathematical operators which seem to be fine:
```css
.mt-\[calc\(1\+\(var\(--something\)\*0\.5\)\)\] {
  margin-top: calc(1 + (var(--something) * 0.5));
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Subtraction in `calc()` arbitrary values not always normalized properly" (#9832)

Issues.Title: Checkboxes not taking dark styles
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.2.4

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v16.14.2

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/WkCzbd6I3M

**Describe your issue**
I am trying to style a checkbox input using tailwind. I have taken some code from [frostbite](https://flowbite.com/docs/forms/checkbox/) which has the styles for light and dark mode all ready set. But neither of the light or dark mode styles for background-color work with inputs.

I have created a tailwind play to show you the example and have set the expected light mode background to be green and the dark mode to be red. I have set the mode to dark and the background color is just the default browers color. If I remove the dark class the input also just styles the same color.

I'm also not sure if there are any other elements that are being effected by this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Checkboxes not taking dark styles" (#9828)

Issues.Title: auto add prefix not working.
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.0 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** **What version of Node.js are you using?** v18.12.1 **What browser are you using?** **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Describe your issue** tailwind.config.js ``` /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ module.exports = { prefix: "xx-", content: [], theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [], purge: { enabled: false, content: ["./**/*.liquid"], }, } ``` I run the command to gen css file : npx tailwindcss build css/application.css -o assets/application.css.liquid But. the result file seem lost all css style. I look like below when I disable the "prefix" config, everything going well. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3196849/201532036-99772fb7-2d5a-4c07-b59f-4fbd39efcc71.png) I think the build system made an error in processing the prefix, but it ended up showing a successful build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "auto add prefix not working." (#9822)

Issues.Title: Console drag to resize is lagging alot after adding tailwind to the project.
Issues.Body:
Hello, I am not sure if this is bug, or strange behavior, or something else... But when i drag my console to resize it, it lags alot. I've just added tailwind package, tailwind config & updated my index.css file. And after removing tailwind, everything comes back to normal...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24592343/201489611-dcb09c4a-ee89-45d7-a390-0fc18d74a8e3.png)

I've created react app with vite, and using chrome.
These are versions i installed:
    "postcss": "^8.4.19",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.2.4",
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Console drag to resize is lagging alot after adding tailwind to the project." (#9819)

Issues.Title: tailwindcss watch mode doesn't work in bash script
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

tailwindcss v3.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

None

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

N/A

Downloaded from 
`curl -sLO https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/releases/latest/download/tailwindcss-macos-arm64`

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

N/A

**Describe your issue**

My `dev.sh` looks like this. When I run `./dev.sh`, the app.css wouldn't be created.
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
tailwindcss -i src/tailwind.css -o dist/app.css -w &
```

However, any of the following works:
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# removed the ampersand
tailwindcss -i src/tailwind.css -o dist/app.css -w
```

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# but doesn't watch
tailwindcss -i src/tailwind.css -o dist/app.css &
```

or run it directly:
```bash
$ tailwindcss -i src/tailwind.css -o dist/app.css -w &
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "tailwindcss watch mode doesn't work in bash script" (#9816)

Issues.Title: create defineConfig utility
Issues.Body:
I saw an issue and  discussion opened so I'm not opening another one for this as the CONTRIBUTING.md says

- #6422 
- #1077 

This PR adds a utility function that correctly types your config so it can be referenced in Javascript code properly.

It accepts the config TailwindCSS is expecting but returns the concrete implementation.

Here's the Typescript Playground that shows you can get the desired config: [Link](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#--N13xsDAIIgvt6wQKcpyHPETHQ1CYM9OCbHSdCTBTPku0uNF6kwxQSFUR53EoAF8OsTwYARdTlTI8j6kaaifggepxgdBiyMxOBJgfeUJOyaCeJ+dJu3iGdPT-XjWP2aSgzA-JhO2WwwqCWT8nSXpthIgE5xscZhLRFLFBXOAAFsTGgXDPnlTxCsDBIyIwaClyDaFrRgeoIBGZ9HPlBBb1NNyGpMExiKQvMyOCdIIFsCquCC-J6l89YAvCzoTDaIDbH3GTOnSbJcRA5CuwiCpQmJUUyheCBsGIJxirlBqMCQC0DyqjIEHpAF6pomBbFaq95SakdaqCDi1UQVC2MGys4BMKo7sCzoCWfEcxOtW1J1sP6uHimoImCU1bG2z00vyV1QXibLlzKbBgDy3SAkGhrxnI-VSMrBAYjqayammjJ0lMw0FsIsZutbCpmv27yMbaBBULmoJJpqEYWKqbnPQimpTQyi5xyZCFsmJ5TQzlip4gG5AV2eCiQEugz3sak8zONZmkFRzhXvyXrjPqUoebxCIRgwRABfyHomspfTo2yBBFlxoMZesfykrjNYDmCfY7w1+cRn1o2gnxmpDaA7JFeNsoIEplRsBwvSnSZ62QaDQ92ZSOA4TZm06bvD3PUY-Iff1cl-ZqLZb3k0WY7G9Ik0EmxbGG9PVvmvFfsxx30bsOWwSlrhs5X3UTiOxRIDgHMK5pjwLnqItbetCWYD6tlZWdmp5IhHU2v-Ci4BNPvrHzk0+uHw3+jgOvL05xppTChnPa0Fxxjp0jnFfkTRhq6xsPEYCPQNKCBeKoC2VcMCHXuniZm0RYE5EfGkUEsUUR4hGAiKIs9--HWCTvEBAn5pEwEwAgRgpBgBwD6R4M+4IeUcsbty5uqR3apM9g1XJfUpViuKOMZRtjpU2FAT7Hl0cEC2CnLeFVNptYEh5cvb2aEoh6vWHaURu96DqFAFYD5JUGpnyImsjlDtOUupMMzYogrDKJXxew9oZEJjZFJcPWiUwh6---OBeA2t0LG2YPwcQ8h3b8WDs4fw8d1L6WlNEEu9d1jt37vFZAKV3TlHnhXc+7Vn7DWmsA5a+p0H2nocCch716HA3MvmYRyNprzP0fObgNNtzJA5ucD5755b9BVshbC9ByLFPYt7YS3T5LDOqMhIgCzm7hWuOPb4+VyjPgIsC++ygX7jX-uA+B+1yXXX9Oy6M7DwbUBFeI+R-blnk2XMze1-N3wS3aBiloKASAsBEAoAAApMceKAMTbXsDkGpk12bieNdY9m2UfrxcIAAApND9Y4GuKAFmKNNSTwANQPqEgA-BwTAIALAgAIE4EAABKDgqgXhlBMKIOAFh1AEGz6QAAPAASWQAAXmQAAJVoiQeoW-O-d+QGPifU+QAAD4KMAHkD-IB3-f5vWhHgcB33P5AT+sJHgTBP8oBv9VxlALM-8QCwD88tA2sD4t8KBotNAEBWAXgB8u9wYGUO8ICEcABuZAxANAgfJjXSEATAAqaAY2e-GfA-e-cArvBHMoC1bAaAnAxgx4KAr-DgWAqAeA7ARAwg1AsAdArQK1MwXSS-fAoQ4gwfMgigwqRrO4GgughgizDPWgWgEQ9QFAE-UgIgR5LAiAFDAgLfFDegw-FDZAAAH2QGb2byzAw1IB4KLxLzL1IFoP33oJQxn00JoGz2gHgEMxPykEtUeQgAAGkIBRDSDYDgAoAt8IjkAIAAAPSAA7cgCwaImLBfV-KQx4CjPvPI3Ax4egyvDzLIuRfIvzDgIo2wkI4QMIyI6Ikg0JOIhIiIwo+-DQmgLPcAQIvPVDZgSmQgUXR4eRJTavY-CAfQ7AQwiQkwrfBosgYAcIqImIto9DKAbomgTPfw-o3PYIiAAAR0wHiNslGMBwmI3HSPeQXx6L6JzyCJQCf3UBBy52wEuO6XkUb0ph4LgKtQEJQ2GIgC+PGIADJKBki0ixBy5 Issues.Title: Allow users to block generation of certain utilities

Issues.Title: Border styles not applying in custom layers
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.2.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 12.3.1, also see the issue with vanilla JS

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.16.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Safari

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/aaZHDFRQKX?file=css

**Describe your issue**

Borders don't apply from custom layers while other styles do apply. I'm not sure if custom layers are supported but it was an unexpected behaviour. Borders work from `@layer base` and `@layer components` but not from `@layer customlayer`. 

My main use case for a custom layer was as a way to differentiate between styles for different features - visually in the code. I'm guessing I should be using something like postcss-import and have different files for a large project using tailwind. 

```css
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

@layer base {

    .border-shows-with-this {
        @apply h-48 w-48 bg-red-600 m-4 border-green-600 border-4;
    }
}

@layer components {

    .border-also-shows-with-this {
        @apply h-48 w-48 bg-red-600 m-4 border-green-600 border-4;
    }
}

@layer different-layer {

    .border-missing-with-this {
        @apply h-48 w-48 bg-red-600 m-4 border-green-600 border-4;
    }
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Border styles not applying in custom layers" (#9809)

Issues.Title: Problem with invalid classname in custom CSS using @apply when watching
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwind 3.2.3

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v19.0.1

**What browser are you using?**

n/a

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS 12.6

**Steps to reproduce**

Download the small example test project:

[tailwind-crash.zip](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/files/9985239/tailwind-crash.zip)

Follow the instructions in the `README.md`

**Describe your issue**

I use a pretty basic setup with CLI scripts in `package.json` like this:

```
{
  "name": "postcss8-tailwind",
  "repository": "",
  "private": true,
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "main": "index.js",
  "license": "MIT",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "tailwindcss -i ./css/site.css -o ./build/css/site.css --postcss --minify --watch",
    "prod": "NODE_ENV=production tailwindcss -i ./css/site.css -o ./build/css/site.css --postcss --minify"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@tailwindcss/forms": "^0.5.3",
    "@tailwindcss/typography": "^0.5.8",
    "alpinejs": "^3.10.5",
    "postcss-import": "^15.0.0",
    "tailwindcss-debug-screens": "^2.2.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "autoprefixer": "^10.4.13",
    "postcss": "^8.4.18",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.2.3"
  }
}
```

Since the JIT, i mainly just use `dev` script to compile my CSS while watching.  The normal and expected behavior when accidentally typing an invalid classname, was the the compiler would see the change, attempt to recompile and spit out an error indicating the line number and invalid class in question.  For a few weeks i've noticed that I would not get this neat output, rather it would stack-trace, and I would have to scroll up in the terminal to find the first line that indicated the file, line number and the class in question that was in valid.

For the past couple of days I've noticed that rather than this stack trace, the compile just gets stuck after the `Rebuilding...` text is output.  No errors, no messages.  Fixing the bad class, causes the file to recompile again with the `Done in XXms` message.  I now have to notice it got stuck manually exit out of the watch, then manually run the command again from CLI to get the stacktrace that I can then scroll back to find the bad classname.

I've updated everything i can think of, including moving from Node 18 to latest Node 19.0.1.  I get this error over multiple projects, so it's not just this one instance. Is there any known issues with the latest version of `PostCSS` or is this coming from `tailwindcss` specifically?

Example of the partial StackTrace when running:

```
‚ûú npm run dev

> postcss8-tailwind@1.0.0 dev
> tailwindcss -i ./css/site.css -o ./build/css/site.css --postcss --minify --watch


Rebuilding...
/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/postcss/lib/input.js:148
      result = new CssSyntaxError(
               ^

CssSyntaxError: tailwindcss: /Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/css/custom/typography.css:5:5: The `right-0x` class does not exist. If `right-0x` is a custom class, make sure it is defined within a `@layer` directive.
    at Input.error (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/postcss/lib/input.js:148:16)
    at AtRule.error (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/postcss/lib/node.js:60:32)
    at processApply (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/expandApplyAtRules.js:376:29)
    at /Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/lib/expandApplyAtRules.js:524:9
    at /Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/processTailwindFeatures.js:55:50
    at Object.Once (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/cli/build/plugin.js:251:19)
    at LazyResult.runOnRoot (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:337:23)
    at LazyResult.runAsync (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/postcss/lib/lazy-result.js:393:26)
    at async Object.watch (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/cli/build/plugin.js:348:13)
    at async build (/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/cli/build/index.js:40:9) {
  reason: 'The `right-0x` class does not exist. If `right-0x` is a custom class, make sure it is defined within a `@layer` directive.',
  file: '/Users/joe/Projects/www/my-site/theme/custom/css/custom/typography.css',
  source: '[x-cloak] { display: none; }\n' +
    '\n' +
    'body {\n' +
    '  &.debug-screens:before {\n' +
    '    @apply left-inherit right-0x;\n' +
    '  }\n' +
    '\n' +
    '  @apply text-gray-600 tracking-[0.6px] ;\n' +
    '}\n' +
    '\n' +
    '.site-logo {\n' +
    '  img, svg {\n' +
    '    @apply h-full;\n' +
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Problem with invalid classname in custom CSS using @apply when watching" (#9798)

Issues.Title: Make sure errors are always displayed when watching for changes
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9798

My testing also revealed an unfortunate DX problem due to the way PostCSS works:

1. Runners are promise based if _any_ plugin is async
2. If any runners error then the promise rejects with an error
3. The error does NOT have access to the _partial_ result that would've been built up
4. Therefore we can't get even a partial list of dependencies to watch for more changes from an initial build

As a result of this, if there is an error produced in a file that is `@import`-ed we won't pick it up as something that can be watched for changes until the build succeeds at least once. The workaround is to fix the error and re-save the input CSS file.  I've added a TODO to find a way to work around this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Make sure errors are always displayed when watching for changes" (#9810)

Issues.Title: Fix watching of files on Linux when renames are involved
Issues.Body:
Fixes #7759

It was still broken because of the order things were firing in but this should work around the problem. The solution here still isn't ideal but without changes to chokidar or a slightly different abstraction I think this is probably as good as we're gonna get.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix watching of files on Linux when renames are involved" (#9796)

Issues.Title: ring-opacity doesn't work with hsl
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.2.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

nextjs 13

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

most recent docker img

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Describe your issue**

ring-opacity doesn't seem to work with hsl defined colors, e.g.

`black: 'hsl(var(--color-black) / 1)',`

using

`ring-black ring-opacity-5` does not change the opacity

`ring-black/5` works
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ring-opacity doesn't work with hsl " (#9793)

We switched to absolute paths and it broke this revealing a lurking bug. Fun.

Fixes #9763

Issues.Title: Scan and use safe strings from google closure compiler output as sources
Issues.Body:
Currently if tailwindcss jit scans through optimized sources generated by google closure compiler it mostly works.
There is a case when some tailwindcss classes contain characters that are replaced by closure compiler, due to it's 'trustedStrings' functionality.

A good example is data variants, where for example `data-[edit=false]` may become `data-[edit\x3dfalse]`
This happens here in the google closure compiler:
https://github.com/google/closure-compiler/blob/060e4905d3182fbaaff93449e4cf4ed787314355/src/com/google/javascript/jscomp/CodeGenerator.java#L2156

This is also the case for all clojurescript based projects as the release builds pass through the google closure compiler.
Ideally the tailwindcss jit should scan for 'safe/trusted' variants as generated by the google closure compiler too.

Relevant: https://github.com/thheller/shadow-cljs/commit/5cf0ea00a08e4de75d30465a9d84b8ad6846e2f8
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scan and use safe strings from google closure compiler output as sources" (#9779)

Issues.Title: `.prose-invert` is declared before and thus overwritten by prose gray scale modifiers
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.2.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
postcss-cli 8.4.18

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v16.13.2

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS 13.0

**Describe your issue**
When using `.prose-invert`¬†with any prose gray scale modifier the `.prose-invert` has no effect because it is declared before those modifiers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`.prose-invert` is declared before and thus overwritten by prose gray scale modifiers" (#9776)

Issues.Title: Fix shadowed variable when using raw content
Issues.Body: Using `{raw: ...}` in the content config no longer works. It looks like the reason why is the `content` variable was being shadowed. I just renamed the variable so `content` remains accessible inside the loop.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix shadowed variable when using raw content" (#9773)
